pr_title: [core] Include rule name in text renderer

timeline.message: [core] Modified test cases for TextRenderer to include the RuleName in the generated output
[core] Modified output of TextRenderer to include the RuleName in the generated output
[core] Removed unnecessary explicit casting of Integer to String

[core] Refactored generation of Text output to use constants defining the 3 different types of text seperators: small '-'; medium ':\t' and large '\t-\t' to increase readability and to standardise the text output.

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be better to place the rule name before the message. Messages are of varying lengths and the rule names will end up misaligned
timeline.author: oowekyala

replies.bodyText:
Hi,
Ok , no problem. I put it there for the moment because @Fernal73 pointed out that this could popetntially break backwards compatibility (see comment #1961 (comment) )
replies.author: GuntherSchrijvers

replies.bodyText: Changed the output to put the RuleName before the description.
replies.author: GuntherSchrijvers

replies.bodyText: Fine with me if backwards compatibility is not an issue. As long as nobody is parsing and stuffing this into a database. Would anybody do this for the text output, anyway?
replies.author: Fernal73

replies.bodyText:
Would anybody do this for the text output, anyway?

Exactly, I wouldn't be concerned too much about backwards compatibility for this text format. Mentioning the change in the release notes should be enough
Thanks for making the change
replies.author: oowekyala

timeline.author: oowekyala

replies.bodyText: Fyi, this is also the case for the other constants, I think, it's easier to correct in an IDE than in GH
